comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: This is actually the Fokker M.18 which was the prototype for the D.I. This particular aircraft differed from the Fokker D.I visually in that instead of a horizontal knife edge at the rear of the fuselage, the fuselage came to a point both vertically and horizontally. A non-standard more angular rudder was installed, but was later replaced on production versions with the standard Fokker 'comma' style rudder. The rear fuselage was also changed from the pointed-rear to a horizontal knife-edged. The same modification was made to the Fokker M.17 prototypes (both single-bay w/ 80 h.p. Oberursel U.O 7-cylinder fitted and the two-bay 100 h.p. Oberursel U.I engined) versions rear fuselages and rudders.
